subject: google-misc: libcr51: add helper library for cr51 validation
commitMessage:
google-misc: libcr51: add helper library for cr51 validation

Added
- hashDescriptor()
  - Get the SH256 of the image descriptor
- validateDescriptor()
  - Validate the image

Tested:
Validated this library by migrating internal code to link to this
and is functional.

Change-Id: I78cf250da2f68d6a3be557a9d773170b774ba524
Signed-off-by: Willy Tu <wltu@google.com>

read
Done
nit: 72 chars
Done
This COULD technically be for non BIOS things right? Wondering if this variable could be more generic.
yeah, this can be any firmware that is signed with cr51 descriptor. I have changed it to firmwareFileBuf.
If we change the biosFileBuf name, we should also change this description.
Done

We should avoid storing extra copies of the firmware in memory where possible. AFAIK you should be able to read regions of the file as needed to do the hashing required to verify the descriptor.

Also, even if you do opt to store the firmware in memory we shouldn't store it in a global variable like this. It should be something you can pass around where it is used and only live as long as needed.

this is done for the readFromBuf to use it in libcr51.

I ran into some issue when trying to remove it from global variable. I'll try to clean it up again.

I was trying to pub the buffer in a class along with the functions below like readFromBuf().
I was having trouble converting that in function pointer in 

```
intf.read
```
Done. did some weird stuff to get lambda with capture variable to convert to function pointer.

You might consider leveraging the flasher library for this, then you can translate the file / device strings directly into a readable unit. I can provide a common class for reading contents.

Also, you shouldn't use a string_view for nul-terminated strings. You would have to use a const char * in this case.

I guess we can just delete this function if that's the cause.

We can pass in the buffer to here after we read the data in the flasher.

I am afraid that how libcr51 is setup might block it like requiring the buffer to be global and accessible to all functions.
We will have to do this after the flasher is upstream. Will close this for now.
I think you need to read the descriptor to figure out which type of hash was used.
Done
If you are validating an image you need to make sure it is also verifying the non-static regions too to guarantee the image is pristine. I don't think the regular verify routine does this.

yeah, I think so. Looks like it in

https://github.com/openbmc/google-misc/blob/master/subprojects/libcr51sign/libcr51sign.c#L417-L420

um... I am not exactly sure how we can validate the non-static regions. In libcr51sign, it got all the static regions and hash them. The hash is used to compare with some expected values.

With non-static regions, we can't do that.

Is validating the non-static region just checking to see if the non-static regions are all zero after flashing it? Checking the for regions that doesn't have IMAGE_REGION_STATIC or PERSISTENT, since the persistent regions won't be zero.

non-static regions will be zeroed.

persistent -> stay around during update.

non-persistent -> don't care.

static -> read only/code logic

Had some discussion offline and concluded that this is a TODO for later.

Some requirement before we can enable validation of non-static regions.
- Signed all regions of the image including the non-static to create the hashes
- Make sure that the new signed image does not break existing validation checks

The make sure that the non-static images which might include important stuff does not change before it is installed.

We will validate the image the same same way by checking the hash of the non-static regions.
These should be configuration changes, not build time code changes.

I have removed it now.

We don't need to do anything here, right? If it should be setup during configuration.
Done
Can we drop this from the change, I'll go fix it separately since I added it.

oops. yeah.

Let me remove this one.

Maybe I should return the hash type along with this.

Maybe we care if it is SHA2 or SHA3?
Ack
You could probably just look up the hash again.
yeah, but I guess we don't really care in general. The image staged will have same hash type and we just care about the result.
I'll have to test this out to see if it actually works.
Tested and this actually works. 👍
this should just take in a std::span<const uint8_t> and just copy it to a vector. Use the flasher to read the file directly instead of using this.
Done
return false here.
Done
remove BIOS. could be any image.
Done
Tested with this and it seems like this works fine. 🎉
Done
Can't we just extract the stored hash from the descriptor? I assume it's already been validated at this point? Or does this require the public key to decrypt the hash?

I think the validation method does nto hash the descriptor. It hashes the different image regions. Maybe it includes the descriptor also.

It is in created in https://github.com/openbmc/google-misc/blob/12e6ad0db531bbdc0b134742798842a25cc929aa/subprojects/libcr51sign/src/libcr51sign.c#L446
Why don't both of these functions just take the file buffer? Then you don't need to copy it a second time into the class.

I guess we don't need it. My thinking is that we read once and let the class manage the different commands. However, that might be kind of confusing.

Might be easier for the user to manage. I'll change it.
Done
Should be called `hpp` to follow our conventions for file naming.
Done
